Twenty year old Iori Kitahara is about to start his new college life. Excited to make the most of his youth he decides to move in with his uncle who happens to run a scuba diving store named "Grand Blue" nearby. Living together with him were his beautiful cousins Chisa and Nanaka Kotegawa. All seems well until he enters the store and finds a gang of macho guys partying naked and drinking. Amongst them, Shinji Tokita and Ryuujirou Kotobuki turn out to be instructors at the store and also go to the same university. Hearing that he was a new fresher to the uni heends up relunctantly getting dragged into their Diving Club "Peek-a-boo" club activities. Unfortunately, the club was still lacking members on fresher's day and Iori ends up dragging a classmate along too, Kouhei Imamura, a handsome guy who catches the attention of many women except his open Otaku way of life ends up keeping everyone away from him. As the new semester begins, the odd mix of personalities ends up leading to a variety of weird and awkward situations.


This show revolves around the college life of characters with quirky personalities that leads to some funny or odd interactions during their everyday lives. You've got a bunch of guys that enjoy drinking and being naked while the girls around them treat it as the norm. Nanaka doesn't mind them that way around in the store but she has a sister complex and gets sexually obssessed with anything Chisa has body contact with. Then you've got Tokita and Ryuujirou's friend Azusa from the all women university who happens to be bisexual, energetic and very open minded. The list goes on... The only people that seem to be normal is Chisa who does her best to ignore it all but that doesn't stop her from being dragged into their activities since they're always around. Iori always ends up with the short end of the stick as he becomes friends with the weird bunch and ends up with all sorts of misunderstandings pinned on him.


Sometimes it feels like the jokes are stretching it a bit - a lot of times they don't stray far from macho guys drinking and getting naked or running around in their underwear. However, the jokes do get a bit more interesting in the second half of the show. It also has its rare more serious slice-of-life moments when it's not being silly and fooling around so that the growing Grand Blue gang end up watching out for each other.


There's no shortage of fan service scenes. Character designs are aesthetically pleasing although their angry serious expressions remind me of Attack on Titan. You'll see the girls in swimsuits quite often since it's a scuba diving club... and the naked macho guys. I don't think there's a single episode where the guys don't strip naked or are at least half naked - it's the norm for the guys. And where there's alcohol involved in any story there's usually sex too and the show isn't afraid to make a joke of out it either. Certain scenes can be... brutal. As for the music, I didn't find anything that stood out other than the odd karaoke style ending theme although, the OP "Grand Blue" fits in with the stereotype image of summer - blue skies, blazing sun and going all out with passion.


It's a weird lively summery, slice-of-life comedy show full of nudity aimed at the young male adult audience, with the odd serious moments that barely touches on scuba diving. It's all about drinking and partying nude - your whole summer YOLO attitude. At least after watching this you'll be a bit more knowledgeable about scuba diving if you weren't already and know what an "Old Man" or "Hamasaki's Wife" can mean in Okinawa.

Grand Blue was not under my radar eventhough a lot of people had already talked and discussed about it considering how well known it is throughout the community because my first impressions told me that it was going to be another generic slice of life anime. However,once i gave it a 2nd change, that is when all of my point of view completely changed. and here is why : 
1. Story (7)
well there is not much of a story considering that it is still belong to the slice of life category but to summarize the things that you are going to expect from here onwards,it all started when an adult teen named Iori Kitahara went off to his uncle's diving shop in order to prepare for his college life but that was when he encountered the local Diving Club, at first you would probably had thought that its going to be just a normal diving club but turns out it consist of full of buff men who spend more time drinking, partying, and stripping naked than actually diving instead, now that's a plot twist! Anyhow, he also met her cute cousin who was then unfortunately had a wrong first impression about Iori and thus beging Iori's journey with the rest of the crew of the diving club.


2. Art (9)


the visuals are absolutely top notch.Probably some of the best ive seen in recent memories and quite an achievement for a comedic anime like this.  all of the character's expression and superb animation really does bring the whole setting to life especially when the whole team when off diving in the ocean along with its breathtaking and crystal clear open waters. Although, character's overreacting facial animations are just cherry on top but they are being overused quite a lot that it can sometimes become stail but overall, fantastic visuals and animation indeed. 


3. Sound (8)


for this category, i feel like the seiyuus did a splendid job playing the roles of the characters. the voices actually blended really well with the character's personalities. if im going to spell out even more, their voice acting might be on par as gintama's character voice acting with all of those overreacting moments which is something very great indeed. as for the music, its your typical and standard slice of life background music without anything noticable but its decent for its own. 



4. Characters (9)


 in my honest opinion, i really like the interactions between the characters. every single one of them had their own style of doing things and unique relationships. for instance, Iori Kitahara and his otaku weirdo friend, Kohei who was tricked to enter the diving club have probably one of the best chemistry in all history of comedic anime. whatever they did from blowing up antics to getting themselves into trouble, they always made me laugh. the same goes to the side characters notably Azusa, she is not one of those kind of "generic women tropes" you can see why if you watch the anime. However,the only character that i dislike are Ryuijiro and Shinji aka the "drunken duo"  not in the sense of pure hate its just that their roles most of the time are just getting drunk and strip naked. i do admit that they can be pretty serious sometimes especially when it comes to diving lessons but forcing iori and kohei to join their alcohol party is something that i really dont like from them eventhough those 2 had grown accustomed with drinking alchohol. 


5. enjoyment/personal opinion (9)


at first when i first found out that the anime is mostly about university students doing crazy stuffs like getting drunk and having a naked party i was turned off by the concept since the cover title literally tells the audience that its going to be an anime about diving. well fortunately it did provided us 3 episodes about diving and im really glad that the characters took it seriously. After i finished the anime, it turned out to be actually great! i was entertained with all of the hilarous moments from it and this is coming from a guy who dont usually watch slice of life anime. if you want to look for comedic anime that doesnt use the cliche tropes and wouldnt mind with all of the over drinking and getting naked stuffs then you should give it a try. 


6. overall (9)

*NO SPOILERS*
[Story 7/10]
It has a basic story. A bunch of university students drinking alcohol and diving.
It is a simple story, done beautifully.
[Art 7/10]
Nothing much to say for the art, it's smooth and colorful. 
[Sound 9/10]
The sound is pretty good. The music, opening, sound effects, ending, everything is on point with the sound. It really catches that summer beach feeling.
[Character 8/10]
Everything about characters is executed well. The designs, the voice acting, the connection between all them, is all done well. It really has interestingly weird characters which are all admirable.
[Enjoyment 8/10]
It's an enjoyable anime. It's funny,diverse and everything they've aimed for. The only cons about itis that some parts of the humor are over-used but it's not that bad though.\n\n
[Overall 7/10]\n
It's a great anime. Combining comedy, slice of life, seinen, you'll really enjoy it from the beginning till the end. The humor, characters, sounds are greatly done. I recommend you watch this anime if you're looking for a goody anime to laugh.\n\n

Grand Blue is a comedy anime about diving, and drinking and college, though mostly the latter two. I'd read the manga first and thought it was hilarious and high quality and in particular thought the facial expressions were funny and really added to a punchline or a comedic back and forth. The anime doesn't disappoint either and has good music and the same funny jokes and gags which usually involve stripping down which I found original. There are also the standard but always good misunderstanding humor. The anime lacks any real substance story or character wise and the jokes themselves can feel somewhat safe orbasic but it's still a fun show that manages to be funny which is no small feat in a culture that seems to have eschewed or replaced comedy with ecchi and moe.

I have not read the manga but this was one of the shows that i was looking forward to this season and it did not disappoint. 
STORY 8: Episodes are usually split into 2 parts and maintains continuity across them. For a show about diving there is very little of it but it hardly matters, the show is gut busting hilarious. And it's refreshing to have the members in college.
ART 7: The underwater scenes are average. It doesn't look breathtakingly beautiful as the characters state. But above land the art hold up well and the some of the faces are remarkable, kind of like whatkonosuba was like


SOUND 7: Nice OP. The VA is good. The background score is okay


CHARACTER 9: Amazing. They all stand out in terms of personality and their antics are something to look forward to


ENJOYMENT 10: Damn, this show is hilarious. I have had to pause episodes becuase i was laughing so much


OVERALL: Comedy of the season for me. Highly recommend it

What a class act this show is. Such a crazy good time. I don't think there was a single bad episode. Some better than others obviously, but all of them had me rolling more than a few times. This show had me hooked from the word go, ngl. From the first episode until the finale credits I was enthralled, this show is without a doubt one of the best anime comedies I've ever seen. It's really good. This show is something else. Gonna be high up for AOTY in my book. 
The characters were so much fun. Everyone at Peek A Boo was such ablast to see. Iori was an awesome lead whom I connected to more than I expected I would. He's actually a genuinely good guy, who also knows how to cut loose and have fun when the time calls for it, and sometimes even when it doesn't, haha. Him and Kohei are such bros, I love their constant bickering and "fighting", great friends all around. Of course the ladies of the show were awesome too, Chisa is a great tsundere and I wuv her, Aina was a sweety who made me laugh a ton, Azusa is a sexy minx who has a good heart too, and of course the siscon Nanaka was great. The club elders were awesome too. I don't think there'd a single character I hated or even mildly disliked. They were all great in some way. 


The strength of this show for me was absolutely it's writing and comedic timing. It was just about perfect. Everything clicked with the comedy really. I laughed more here than I have any other anime comedy I think. Every episode was so good with that. From oolong tea to vegetables up butts, it was hilarious to see every week. It's hard to describe comedy in a bubble but Damn this one had me rolling way too many times to count or get across as well at it deserves. Overall I loved this show, that's no surprise really though. Been gushing about it every week. It's amazing really. Easy giving it this score.


10/10.

As the season is coming to its end, I do have to say that Grand Blue is by far my No.1 most hyped Anime for this season. Not only because it's funny and all, but, also it orientated around university lifestyle which rarely seen in anime. The amount of humour and laughter were outstandingly narrated, and yes, adapted well with the manga in my opinion (though, fewer swear words than the manga). 
Here is my breakdown: 
Story (9/10) - My I rated so highly, well, it reflects what's life like at university, and I can reflect it since I experience it all too. The storylinewas adapted accordingly to the manga which I enjoyed the most. Despite some cutout scenes from the manga, the show never stopped to entertain me on a Friday night. 


Art (9/10) - The underwater diving was beautifully animated, but, the standout animation was the characters design. I fell in love with the animation since the first episode, and damn they looked glamorous. 


Sound (8/10) - Amazing background music was played to suit the atmosphere of the scene, and not to mention the music to fits the seaside environment. Did I suggest that the opening was quite liva loca!!   


Character (8/10) - Some characters can be a bit disappointing, but overall, the characters in the diving club were the key highlights to what makes the show spark. The amount of humour elicits at each scene's captivated my love for this show even more. 


Enjoyment (10/10) - When I rank it my best show for this season it has to be the level of enjoyment evoked at each episode. But it's mostly down to the level of alcoholism and jokes integrated into this show gave me the happiness I needed. 


Overall, I gave it 9/10, as it also made it to my top 10 favourite anime of all time. Now I hope for a season 2 to carry on this ridiculous storyline of university life.

Grand Blue made a much better entry than I expected in the first episode. I can say this is one of the best animes of the season. The characters are designed quite spectacular. Especially muscular naked men... (I'm laughing even now)
Also it's a very entertaining. One of the animes I do not want to finish right now. I have no idea what will happen in the future as I have not read the manga, but these last seven episodes have never disappointed me.
Although there is not much incident about diving right now as a sport, it is an anime that should be watched for thecomedy.\n

Grand Blue is an AMAZING MANGA and I highly recommend you guys to read the manga after you have watched episode 1 of the anime to get the voices in your head. Shifting away from the "on how to watch" (which is up to you), the adaptation is so far on point with the manga which makes me very happy! Within 4 episodes in, it looks like the format for each episode is going to cover 2 chapters of manga! This show is basically, If you like comedy such as Gintama, you will definitely love Grand Blue; a show about daily struggles of students duringtheir college life; a setting that is not often explored by anime.\n

(EDITED)
Did I find this funny? YES
Will you find this funny? Probably not 
Grand Blue is, when you really boil it down, a comedy anime about diving. It would be strange to try to compare it to anything else, however, the show decides that it also wants to be about diving and college life and it gets really muddled when trying to review it. (I’ll try to do the best that I can)
Story: 7
I’m gonna have to give the story a 7.
Comedy-wise, this shows has a very strong similarity to Prison School with its HIGHLY detailed reaction faces. I really can’t over exaggerate how comedic andshadowed each and every reaction is, and that it’s strongest feature. In terms of an actual story, it’s average considering it’s a comedy anime but actually teaches the viewer a thing or two every once and awhile. 


Art: 8

HIGHLY ALMOST CRIMINALLY detailed reactions… but unpolished messes when it comes to regular expressions. 


I don’t even want to KNOW how long it took to draw most of those reactions it's simply amazing 10 out of 10. HOWEVER, everything is average, nothing too good and sometimes it dips down to disgusting in certain scenes. You really can’t tell too much since 90% of the show is reaction scenes but holy shit.


Sound: 7 (EDIT)

Idk… I want to give it a higher score but it’s so forgettable I don’t even have anything to give it besides... Mediocre. That being said, the opening for this show is AMAZING and deserves an extra two stars simply for its existence. 


 Characters: 6

Prison school 


The main character is literally an older version of Kiyoshi Fujino who’s prepared to strip down to his underwear subconsciously. The show has a weird effect where the less relevant the character is, the more interesting they become.


Enjoyment: 10

Even with all these flaws, it’s still one of my favorite comedy anime


Don’t get me wrong, however, this show is FAR from a masterpiece. In all honesty, it’s not a show that you HAVE to take at face value or else your experience with it will be shitty. 


Overall…: 7


I wanted to give it a 6 but because of how many times it made me laugh out loud, It’s better than Prison school, at least. 


EDIT: gonna have to pull a fast one and raise the overall to a nine for the simple reason that I have NEVER laughed at a show as many times as I laughed at Grand Blue... Sorry

Personally, I think this is the anime of the season.
I enjoy almost all genres, from action packed, to dull, uneventful quiet slice of life. 
I usually like deep, well written, and novel like narration in animes. For example, 3-gatsu no Lion, Hyouka, Mahotsukai no Yome, etc. 
However, this takes the cake for me this season. 
Extremely funny, hilarious characters, great summer setting for a summer anime, nice intro music.
If you are looking for something with deeper character progression and serious story, this isn't for you. This is mindless fun in a fun setting with fun characters. 
It's not one of those heartwarming slow paced sliceof life, on the contrary, this is a slightly faster paced bomb of silliness.

Grand Blue
Hahaha where to begin with this anime. There is so many things wrong with this anime, and so many done right. To begin, this anime stretches the limits of what you may have believed as 'proper to be shown' on an anime show. You will be teased, you will be taught, you will be duped, and you will be scooped up in this wild journey rushing along with these crazy college characters. The story is about everything you shouldn't do, but probably should do while you are 'young' (of mind). 
The story is about a freshman college gent who moves to a new townand is assigned to live with this uncle. His uncle happens to own basically a fraternity clubhouse for scuba diving (and drinking). Little did this gentleman know what he was walking into... Yet, he learns and masters the art of shoondickyfoo. I made that word up to describe the amount of blarg that this guy lives through and thus learns to create upon this world. He is truly a guru of shenanigans.\n\n
Story - 7 - This is a slice of life genre about getting acclimatized with college life and learning to scuba dive.\n
Graphics - 10 - The facial expressions of these characters are absolutely well done. Bravo. 10 points for this.\n
Soundtrack - 8 - Upbeat and fun. Nothing stuck with me as absolutely amazing, but very well done.\n
Character personas - 10 - These characters are absolutely ridiculous and own up to their characters well.\n
Character voice actors - 10 - PLENTY of emotion\n\n
Overall - 8\n
Recommended - Yes, if you are looking for a comedy that will stretch your boundary of what you may deem 'acceptable' to watch. (Do not watch around kids). Ha. Haha. Ha.

“Isn’t this what memories of youth are meant to be like?”
Grand Blue is an absolutely hilarious take on youth. It induced in me a nostalgia for a youth I never had, a yearning for a beauty I’ve never seen, and most importantly, it was one of the most enjoyable animes I have seen in a long time. It is perhaps telling that I am writing my first ever review about this show. 
Plot 8/10
Superficially speaking there isn’t much plot. If anything, I would say it is more like a sitcom situated roughly along the lines of a story. Every episode is interesting in its ownway. This is not to say there is no character development. On the contrary, there is plenty, and unlike some animes that stretch character development to the boundaries of ad nauseam, Grand Blue exercises great subtlety in fleshing out the characters. 


Art 10/10 

It would be a great pity if an anime with diving as its main theme and with 3 episodes set on a tropical island under starry skies and surrounded by sparkling blue seas should succumb to unworthy art. Well, you will be heartened to know that Grand Blue most certainly does not fail in this aspect. The detail of the art is worth mentioning too. With the exception of the motif of censoring, every detail is constructed brilliantly. TL;DR the art is great. 


Script 10/10

I’m one for dialogue and I believe Grand Blue has the whole range of captivating dialogue. 


All in all, do give Grand Blue a watch if you haven’t. I admit the premise didn’t really interest me at the start and for the longest of times I left it to rot at the back of my mind. But god I am thankful I gave it a chance. I might even go and learn diving. 

*a cautionary note: Having watched it I can’t actually say this anime is about diving though. I think it is more about drinking. On a side note I would love to try Spirytus.

I wasn't sure what to make of this anime... on the one hand, its humor was rather amusing; on the other, the plot, or lack thereof, caused a gap for the story to become simultaneously enjoyable and substantial. 
We follow a young man, Iori, who wanted to start his college life in an exciting way, by moving to his uncle's town and plunging himself into an unfamiliar environment. Instead of following the plan he set out for himself, he was forced to join the diving club, and in turn, dragged another Freshman with him. At the beginning, Iori was very resistant to joining and wasagainst certain "quirky practices," for lack of a better term to avoid spoilers. 


However, before anything else could happen, Iori ended up going with the flow, as if there was nothing wrong in the first place. This happens time and time again throughout the series - a problem will present itself and instead of there being a resolution, another character will push for something else or a silly event will happen, so that we forget about the initial concern.


The appeal is certainly there, as we've all probably been in situations that caused us to come out of our comfort zone. Also, who does not want to "make most of their youth?"  But unfortunately, there is no true conflict and the characters have no real personalities; they are stand-ins for random cliches we experience. Since we, the audience, can relate, this produces a guise of a good story. There were even some hints at romance, but there was nothing really significant to back up that movement in the narrative. 


What's more is that the anime is supposedly about Iori and the diving club, however, any real diving (barely any was even done, if I may add) only happened at the tail end of the season. We also get lured into this whole idea of being in a college org, being invited into a new family that celebrates the same hobby, but several of these characters had no value added and were not even necessary. I think Free! had even more swimming and conflict resolution/character development.


The episodes air more time about getting wasted and cursing celibacy. I usually try not to mind fan service, but the series milked the "we're all virgins and are hungry to get some" too much. I admit that many of the scenes were funny, but there were those that were borderline disrespectful. 


Though real content may not exactly have been there, I ended up rating higher than expected because of the value for comedy. Again, many times, it was at the boundary of being disturbing, but I did have many guffaws from of the ridiculousness of it all. 


What they lack in story matter, they make up for in creativity, silliness, and entertainment. The show presented a mixture of slapstick, farcical, hyperbolic, and even blue humor, so that the audience would not get satiated. I thoroughly enjoyed laughing myself off at the, albeit 2D (as they lack depth and dimension), characters. 


Overall, this anime may not be for you if you're looking for a good story, but should mindless fun be your fancy, you may thoroughly enjoy Grand Blue.

To start off, I didn't expect much from this anime.  A show about a college scuba club, doesn't sound terribly appealing.  I decided to give it a shot.  And this was a great move, because it led to an anime that was simply hilarious in its execution.
I will say, there wasn't much worthwhile out of the story, but that isn't always a bad thing.  With no need to remember every character (I still can't distinguish between the regularly shown male club members) means you can really jump into the series at just about any point and still enjoy it.  
Ifyou're looking for a complex, deep, meaningful story... go to a different show.  If you find the actions of blackout drunk people to be hilarious... come on in and give this show a watch.

Opinion & Informal
Art: 8/10 It was good. Anatomy and proportions were...both normal and interesting lol. The main duo, the MC and his otaku buddy, were normal. The girls too, they were about normal for a male targeted anime. The girls in this show had pretty crazy proportions and figures. Curves, all at least double-D, flawless faces, etc. I don't dislike sexualized female characters too much. It fit into the vibe of this show so I mostly overlooked it. This show was meant as a show to relax and let loose to me. So I thought to just enjoy both the hilariouscomedy and the pretty girls. The scenery was nice. There was some nice showcasing of nature: the world under the surface, the wildlife, everything. The faces and mannerisms of the characters are so unique, unique as in really awesome and different; the idea of using distorted anatomy and faces isn't new, but this show did it damn well. The art in general was crisp, clean, and really nice to look at. 


Animation: 7/10 It was fluid. The animation quality was about average. There weren't any noticeable shortcuts or places where they skimped out. The animation was an average-good. Nothing really to point out that was bad.


Characters: 9/10 The characters along with the artstyle and interesting scenarios are what really made this show what it is. The characters never made a moment boring. The characters made this show so enjoyable that episodes seemed to fly by. I wouldn't say well written, but these characters were very much so well done. They didn't need complex back stories or personalities. It was their general dynamics with one another to the scenarios they were in are what made them so great. The character designs weren't too interesting except for the pretty-boy otaku. That was pretty unconventional: the first introduction to him where it pans down to his anime shirt...that was hilarious. 


Plot: 7/10 It's a show about diving...I mean...uhh...THIS IS A WORK OF FICTION. UNDERAGE DRINKING IS STRONGLY PROHIBITED AND ILLEGAL. SCENES INVOLVING ALCOHOL WITH FORCEFUL CONSUMPTION AND SHAMEFUL ACTS ARE NOT ENCOURAGED. PLEASE VIEW THIS AS A COMEDY. FURTHERMORE, ALL CHARACTERS APPEARING IN THIS WORK ARE OF LEGAL AGE. 


Development: 7/10 Drinking.


Music: 6/10 The OP is super catchy. The ED was meh. The bgm was nice but unmemorable. Soundboard was used nicely in the comedy. No real sound design.


Conclusion: 6/10 Open-ended ending for the future of fun. Motivated me enough to pick up the manga. No questions were really there to be answered with the conclusion so there isn't much complexity to this conclusion. It was a standard ending. 


Overall: 8/10 This was great. It's shows like these that motivate me to continue my hobby of watching anime no matter how bad the slumps get.

Really fun, with nice and attractive character and color designs, and great character interaction. I suppose I can see the criticism towards the type of humor, but personally I found it endearing. 
There's plenty of dull 'four cute girls do mildly funny cute girl things', and this is comparable to that, but ten times better and with bros humor instead of cute things. And you aren't meant to fap the dudes, I think. You're meant to fap YOUR HEART to the bro-hood.
There are times the animation feels less than excellent, but it's always what it needs to be in the moment to serve the role.If the moment is meant to be beautiful, it's beautiful, if it's meant to comedic, it's comedic. \n\n
Pretty good, 8/10 would tag my bros with 'this is so us' on Facebook like the boomer I am inside.

This is the type of show that has a type of humor that won’t resonate with everyone but if you enjoy it, you will end up loving it. 
For me, this show checks off all the right boxes to be something in the great category. It has some great humor accompanied by over the top facial reactions but that’s not all, it has some (read few) serious moments that bring things back down to Earth. 
I can say with certainty my sides exploded from laughter more than a few times during the course of this show. But it’s not just the humor or faces thatmake this a great show. The actual plot of diving, and when they do get in the ocean, take it from just being humorous to having a purpose. It gives it a level of depth (pun intended) that i find hard to see in some comedies like Prison School for example. 


As for the characters, all of their quirks made things interesting and it meant that every interaction was going to be enjoyable even if it was a 1 on 1 talk. Chisa, to me, felt like one of the best characters because she keeps the entire series grounded and from going off on too big a tangent when Iori or Kouhei get into shenanigans. The other characters also didn’t feel like background noise, they made contributions and very minor characters like a bar owner used time to really bring out some humor. Again, it has a great balance. 


Of course this anime has flaws, it by no means is a 10. I felt the adaptation rushed or fumbled the ball on some of the jokes compared to the manga. One joke with a truck needed an explanation and will leave you confused unless you have read the manga or know road laws. I also found issue with the pace at times but they wanted to stretch time between jokes to keep things grounded so it’s not exactly a flaw but more a nitpick. 


Now I’ve said a lot about how this show is humorous as any review will, but also grounded. The show captures what people picture sometimes as a crazy college life. I can’t recommend this show enough to everyone although I know it’s not for everyone. Kind of like diving to be honest. 


9/10 One of the funniest things ever
